sentence.text: Although MPC is composed of two subunits, it has been reported that the mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport subunit is specifically associated with poor prognosis in several cancers, including colorectal and prostate cancer.

However, only a few studies have assessed the clinical significance of mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport and the molecular mechanisms underlying its influence on cancer progression are not well understood.
Low mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport expression correlated with poor ICC prognosis and was correlated with tumor invasion and distant metastasis.

Therefore, we investigated the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II of altering the mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport gene expression on the malignant potential of cancer cells using biliary tract cancer cell lines in vitro.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Furthermore, the inhibition of mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport expression induced EMT in cancer cells, and the overexpression of mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport suppressed the migration of tumor cells.
These results indicated that mitochondrial pyruvate transmembrane transport could be a novel therapeutic target in some cancers
